topic.title: Zeronet is awesome - revolution anyone?
topic.body: We're going to some interesting things developing now.

topic.title: I explore ZeroNet and document it on ZeroNet
topic.body:
I found out about ZeroNet and felt what the rest of you are feeling right now...

So I started exploring this wonderful beast that we're feeding now, and this is the result: [Ace's ZeroNet Exploration](/1NfVz57ebbUae6DiksXR88ZgwY9VY1jQiH).

Tips and suggestions are welcome!

topic.title: Need developers
topic.body:
I'm looking for javascript devs to build tools and apps for ZeroNet.

I'm open for both paid development and partnership on the stuff that will be built - so it's really up to the dev.

You can send me a ZeroMail message to **acehigh**.

topic.title: Assuming I'm using multiuser/proxy ZeroNet - where is my data stored?
topic.body: So let's say I'm using ZeroNet through bit.no.com:43110 (ZeroNet proxy) - where would my ID be stored? How can I share my ID across multiple devices?

topic.title: PSA: Using ZeroNet with the default configuration is exposing your identity to anyone on your network!
topic.body:
[If you install ZeroNet client and run it using the default configuration, i.e. not in multi-user mode, anyone who tries to access your computer through your local network, using your machine name or ip address, will see ZeroNet through your identity!](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NfVz57ebbUae6DiksXR88ZgwY9VY1jQiH/?Post:19)

[Read more...](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NfVz57ebbUae6DiksXR88ZgwY9VY1jQiH/?Post:19)

topic.title: What kind of projects you have in mind now that you begin to understand ZeroNet?
topic.body:
I'll start!

We should clone Facebook 1-to-1 (UI/style/functionality) and make it available as both a public multiuser platform like facebook is, and a simple copy-paste do-your-own-social-network ability baked in like we have with other apps.

3_168qV1Xxp2EyszrzdECLUwXrn9wGYjDdar.body: I write about my experience on ZeroNet. [zero/1NfVz57ebbUae6DiksXR88ZgwY9VY1jQiH](/1NfVz57ebbUae6DiksXR88ZgwY9VY1jQiH)

> [nullpo](#comment_17_16Szsy1UtjiXpEevWVdUDrNfNTAZ9PLbcY): I created a simple text board where you can post without an account registered at ZeroID, but with one created in the browser:http://127.0.0.1:43110/16KzwuSAjFnivNimSHuRdPrYd1pNPhuHqN
> This is an experiment that utilizes bitcoinjs-lib to generate an account without any central server.

This is very nice!

1_19hZjnvGuFY2sB3nDpX6869nJgkXURTvxX.body:
למי שמעוניין יש קבוצת "זירונט ישראלי" בפייסבוק - קבוצת דיונים בשפה העברית (אבל לא רק) בנושאי זירונט בארץ ובכלל

https://www.facebook.com/groups/1770630863164888/

1_1PtoWgfjhzMK8qz1eTVG3QsawNQ4DL8c8Y.body:
> [shift](#comment_48_16AFTG7vdicwJbRQpWc2F9BRHTE5MTftE7): am i right? zero mail = bit message ?

I think I saw it in the support page as a successfully implemented feature - so it makes sense. 

Can anyone confirm?

5_1Kg7CXZM5h3wTPENsTDwWUmRBf9VhYy2cW.body:
> [nofish](#comment_450_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): By default ZeroNet binds to 127.0.0.1, so remote access is not possible.

You are correct - the problem is not as bad, but if someone uses your machine (i.e. little sister/brother) and tries to access your local `:43110` port they will see your identity and be able to sign stuff on ZN with it.

I've updated the post to reflect your comment, cheers!

3_1Kg7CXZM5h3wTPENsTDwWUmRBf9VhYy2cW.body:
> [overflow](#comment_3_17JSHDd8Hub7LDtYzGD8XPjtQWpiEnVrhR): @acehigh ima js dev, what are you looking to have made?

Hey @overflow!
I want to have a few templates made either on top of ZeroBlog's engine (or maybe a new one, I'm open to ideas) and some basic site templates.

> [eugenere](#comment_2_1NUPS87CLEtEmee1AGvmY7iSbvpC9JWHxy): need explain more

What kind of explanation do you need? I'd rather not completely disclose the full aspect of what I need done to the entirety  of ZeroNet - I need JS/HTML/CSS devs to build a number of apps/sites that I have in mind, obviously more details will be given once we start some kind of private communication...

> [noiamo](#comment_25_14XxpXNGMLsyeQxikacrbQnAFXVyhN5Ngx): Who isn't looking for a js developer?

Anyone who haven't heard of ZeroNet :D
